CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 13, 1946, pg. 1, reads: "Demonstration of Unity - A billboard urging religious and racial tolerance was dedicated Wednesday afternoon at Smithfield Street and Boulevard of the Allies under sponsorship of the American Legion of Allegheny County and Mayor David L. Lawrence.  Among the key figures in the dedication ceremonies were, left to right: Rabbi B. A. Lichter, B'Nai Israel Synagogue; the Rev. Harold L. Tolliver, pastor of Grace Presbyterian Church; the Rev. Cannon Edward M. Wilson of Trinity Cathedral, and the Rev. Father D. A. Lawless of St. Mary of Mercy Catholic Church. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Rabbi B. A. Lichter, Rev. Harold L. Tolliver, Cannon Edward M. Wilson, and Father D. A. Lawless  posing in front of billboard inscribed "Join the Fight Against Religious and Racial Hate... sponsored by Mayor David Lawrence...."
